{"step_by_step_thinking": "The card test is a clinical test used to assess the function of the adductor pollicis muscle. This muscle is responsible for adducting the thumb. During the card test, a card is placed between the thumb and index finger and the patient is asked to hold it while the examiner tries to pull it away. If the patient is unable to hold the card, it indicates weakness or dysfunction in the adductor pollicis muscle.", "answer_choice": "D. Adductor pollicis"}
